name: Tinolang tahong
description: Tinolang tahong, a delightful and nutritious dish, is perfect for those who love a healthy meal with a high-protein, high-sodium, and high-fiber profile. This recipe promises not just a burst of flavors but also a wealth of health benefits, making it a perfect addition to your collection of Healthy Recipes and Healthified Recipes.
recipeIngredient: 1  tsp ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the mussels under cold water, scrubbing the shells to remove any dirt or debris.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and chop the garlic and ginger root. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice the red onion. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the papaya, remove the seeds, and cut it into cubes. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic, ginger, and sliced onion. Saut√© for about 5 minutes until softened.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the mussels to the pot and cook for 3-5 minutes until they start to open.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add enough water to cover the mussels, then season with salt and ground black pepper. Bring to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Once boiling, add the cubed papayas and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the papaya is tender and the mussels are fully opened.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Discard any mussels that did not open. Adjust the seasoning if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot and enjoy your nutritious Tinolang tahong.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 10
